Description: The song is an accompaniment in a movie/tv show scene or a video by a social media influencer. Thus, it is expected to be in the background and mixed with non-music noise. Additionally, it might be shingled and there might be other songs contained.
Examples: Kayaking video with ``Radioactive’’ by Imagine Dragons: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wh8Bgp7bO3I, a scene from the movie ``Cocktail’’ with the song `Àddicted to Love’’: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EFuBvEt84OI

Description: The song is covered by an amateur and typically the audio recorded with a camera. Thus, low fidelity is expected with potential timbre changes and non-music noise. Some covers only refer to sections (eg. guitar solos).
Examples: Vocal cover by ``I don’t wanna miss a thing’’ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wTLjssYFXBQ

Description: In case of professionally recorded covers in studios, most artists exhibit alterations in pitch- and rhythmic regards.
Examples: A cover by ``Smells like teen spirit’’ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6wLZhNoYY_c

Description: Only the drum track of the song, therefore harmony and melody are not contained and timbre is changed strongly.
One harmonic instrument only (eg. piano, guitar). This can either be associated with a recording or automatically generated (eg. piano roll).
Examples: generated piano for ``She came through the bathroom window’’ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m9fWu0TJuaM

Description: The vocal track is dropped in the song. This typically accounts for karaoke versions.
Examples: reaction to an instrumental cover of `M̀y hear will go on’’ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=72fTwwijaZw

Description: A live performance recorded from the audience.
Examples: ``Enter sandman’’ live after a football match filmed from audience: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uZgyjmtYevM , Ariana Grande live from the audience: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=girdko2YOjQ

Description: A song which contains samples from the query song. The samples might be whole sections (typically the chorus) or just very short melodic lines.
A song which contains (typically sections of) multiple songs. One of the songs is (a section of) the query song.
Examples: Medley containing ``Can’t get next to you’’ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tA7iy_-ZdkY

Description: A video in which the someone consumes the query song along with comments and potential analysis. Thus, non-music noise is expected.
Examples: Reaction to an instrumental cover of ``My hear will go on’’ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=72fTwwijaZw , reaction to Lionel Richie and Kenny Rogers https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lZaTGPjaoE4

Description: A video in which the uploader instructs about how to play, sing or mix the query song. Hence, non-music noise is expected and sometimes only sections might be contained.
A video containing multiple songs of the same artist or same genre as the query song.
Only the vocal stem of the query song. Either isolated automatically by sound source seperation or an acapella cover.
